segment.source: 4865(S) A trusted forest information entry was added.
segment.target: 4865(S) A trusted forest information entry was added.

segment.source: (Windows 10)
segment.target: (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes security event 4865(S) A trusted forest information entry was added.
segment.target: Describes security event 4865(S) A trusted forest information entry was added.

segment.source: 4865(S): A trusted forest information entry was added.
segment.target: 4865(S): A trusted forest information entry was added.

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016
segment.target: Windows Server 2016

segment.source: Event Description:
segment.target: Event Description:

segment.source: This event generates when new trusted forest information entry was added.
segment.target: This event generates when new trusted forest information entry was added.

segment.source: This event is generated only on domain controllers.
segment.target: This event is generated only on domain controllers.

segment.source: Note For recommendations, see Security Monitoring Recommendations for this event.
segment.target: Note For recommendations, see Security Monitoring Recommendations for this event.

segment.source: Event XML:
segment.target: Event XML:

segment.source: Required Server Roles: Active Directory domain controller.
segment.target: Required Server Roles: Active Directory domain controller.

segment.source: Minimum OS Version: Windows Server 2008.
segment.target: Minimum OS Version: Windows Server 2008.

segment.source: Event Versions: 0.
segment.target: Event Versions: 0.

segment.source: Field Descriptions:
segment.target: Field Descriptions:

segment.source: Subject:
segment.target: Subject:

segment.source: Security ID Type = SID: SID of account that requested the “add a trusted forest information entry” operation.
segment.target: Security ID Type = SID: SID of account that requested the “add a trusted forest information entry” operation.

segment.source: Event Viewer automatically tries to resolve SIDs and show the account name.
segment.target: Event Viewer automatically tries to resolve SIDs and show the account name.

segment.source: If the SID cannot be resolved, you will see the source data in the event.
segment.target: If the SID cannot be resolved, you will see the source data in the event.

segment.source: Note A security identifier (SID) is a unique value of variable length used to identify a trustee (security principal).
segment.target: Note A security identifier (SID) is a unique value of variable length used to identify a trustee (security principal).

segment.source: Each account has a unique SID that is issued by an authority, such as an Active Directory domain controller, and stored in a security database.
segment.target: Each account has a unique SID that is issued by an authority, such as an Active Directory domain controller, and stored in a security database.

segment.source: Each time a user logs on, the system retrieves the SID for that user from the database and places it in the access token for that user.
segment.target: Each time a user logs on, the system retrieves the SID for that user from the database and places it in the access token for that user.

segment.source: The system uses the SID in the access token to identify the user in all subsequent interactions with Windows security.
segment.target: The system uses the SID in the access token to identify the user in all subsequent interactions with Windows security.

segment.source: When a SID has been used as the unique identifier for a user or group, it cannot ever be used again to identify another user or group.
segment.target: When a SID has been used as the unique identifier for a user or group, it cannot ever be used again to identify another user or group.

segment.source: For more information about SIDs, see Security identifiers.
segment.target: For more information about SIDs, see Security identifiers.

segment.source: Account Name Type = UnicodeString: the name of the account that requested the “add a trusted forest information entry” operation.
segment.target: Account Name Type = UnicodeString: the name of the account that requested the “add a trusted forest information entry” operation.

segment.source: Account Domain Type = UnicodeString: subject’s domain or computer name.
segment.target: Account Domain Type = UnicodeString: subject’s domain or computer name.

segment.source: Formats vary, and include the following:
segment.target: Formats vary, and include the following:

segment.source: Domain NETBIOS name example: CONTOSO
segment.target: Domain NETBIOS name example: CONTOSO

segment.source: Lowercase full domain name: contoso.local
segment.target: Lowercase full domain name: contoso.local

segment.source: Uppercase full domain name: CONTOSO.LOCAL
segment.target: Uppercase full domain name: CONTOSO.LOCAL

segment.source: For some well-known security principals, such as LOCAL SERVICE or ANONYMOUS LOGON, the value of this field is “NT AUTHORITY”.
segment.target: For some well-known security principals, such as LOCAL SERVICE or ANONYMOUS LOGON, the value of this field is “NT AUTHORITY”.

segment.source: For local user accounts, this field will contain the name of the computer or device that this account belongs to, for example: “Win81”.
segment.target: For local user accounts, this field will contain the name of the computer or device that this account belongs to, for example: “Win81”.

segment.source: Logon ID Type = HexInt64: hexadecimal value that can help you correlate this event with recent events that might contain the same Logon ID, for example, “4624: An account was successfully logged on.”
segment.target: Logon ID Type = HexInt64: hexadecimal value that can help you correlate this event with recent events that might contain the same Logon ID, for example, “4624: An account was successfully logged on.”

segment.source: Trust Information:
segment.target: Trust Information:

segment.source: Forest Root Type = UnicodeString: the name of the Active Directory forest for which trusted forest information entry was added.
segment.target: Forest Root Type = UnicodeString: the name of the Active Directory forest for which trusted forest information entry was added.

segment.source: Forest Root SID Type = SID: the SID of the Active Directory forest for which trusted forest information entry was added.
segment.target: Forest Root SID Type = SID: the SID of the Active Directory forest for which trusted forest information entry was added.

segment.source: Event Viewer automatically tries to resolve SIDs and show the account name.
segment.target: Event Viewer automatically tries to resolve SIDs and show the account name.

segment.source: If the SID cannot be resolved, you will see the source data in the event.
segment.target: If the SID cannot be resolved, you will see the source data in the event.

segment.source: Operation ID Type = HexInt64: unique hexadecimal identifier of the operation.
segment.target: Operation ID Type = HexInt64: unique hexadecimal identifier of the operation.

segment.source: You can correlate this event with other events (4866(S): A trusted forest information entry was removed, 4867(S): A trusted forest information entry was modified.) using this field.
segment.target: You can correlate this event with other events (4866(S): A trusted forest information entry was removed, 4867(S): A trusted forest information entry was modified.) using this field.

segment.source: Entry Type Type = UInt32: the type of added entry:
segment.target: Entry Type Type = UInt32: the type of added entry:

segment.target: Value

segment.source: Type Name
segment.target: Type Name

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: ForestTrustTopLevelName
segment.target: ForestTrustTopLevelName

segment.source: The DNS name of the trusted forest.
segment.target: The DNS name of the trusted forest.

segment.source: The structure used for this record type is equivalent to LSAUNICODESTRING
segment.target: The structure used for this record type is equivalent to LSAUNICODESTRING

segment.source: ForestTrustTopLevelNameEx
segment.target: ForestTrustTopLevelNameEx

segment.source: This type commonly used for name suffix exceptions.
segment.target: This type commonly used for name suffix exceptions.

segment.source: The structure used for this record type is equivalent to LSAUNICODESTRING.
segment.target: The structure used for this record type is equivalent to LSAUNICODESTRING.

segment.source: ForestTrustDomainInfo
segment.target: ForestTrustDomainInfo

segment.source: This field specifies a record containing identification and name information
segment.target: This field specifies a record containing identification and name information

segment.source: Flags Type = UInt32: The following table specifies the possible flags.
segment.target: Flags Type = UInt32: The following table specifies the possible flags.

segment.source: Some flag values are reused for different forest record types.
segment.target: Some flag values are reused for different forest record types.

segment.source: See the “Meaning” column for more information.
segment.target: See the “Meaning” column for more information.

segment.target: Value

segment.source: Trust Type
segment.target: Trust Type

segment.target: Meaning

segment.source: No flags were set.
segment.target: No flags were set.

segment.target: ForestTrustTopLevelNameEx

segment.target: ForestTrustTopLevelName

segment.target: The top-level name trust record is disabled during initial creation.

segment.target: ForestTrustDomainInfo

segment.target: The domain information trust record is disabled by the domain administrator.

segment.source: Top Level Name Type = UnicodeString: the name of the new trusted forest information entry.
segment.target: Top Level Name Type = UnicodeString: the name of the new trusted forest information entry.

segment.source: DNS Name Type = UnicodeString: DNS name of the trust partner.
segment.target: DNS Name Type = UnicodeString: DNS name of the trust partner.

segment.source: This parameter might not be captured in the event, and in that case appears as “-”.
segment.target: This parameter might not be captured in the event, and in that case appears as “-”.

segment.source: NetBIOS Name Type = UnicodeString: NetBIOS name of the trust partner.
segment.target: NetBIOS Name Type = UnicodeString: NetBIOS name of the trust partner.

segment.source: This parameter might not be captured in the event, and in that case appears as “-”.
segment.target: This parameter might not be captured in the event, and in that case appears as “-”.

segment.source: Domain SID Type = SID: SID of the trust partner.
segment.target: Domain SID Type = SID: SID of the trust partner.

segment.source: This parameter might not be captured in the event, and in that case appears as “NULL SID”.
segment.target: This parameter might not be captured in the event, and in that case appears as “NULL SID”.

segment.source: Security Monitoring Recommendations
segment.target: Security Monitoring Recommendations

segment.source: For 4865(S): A trusted forest information entry was added.
segment.target: For 4865(S): A trusted forest information entry was added.

segment.source: Any changes related to Active Directory forest trusts (especially creation of the new trust) must be monitored and alerts should be triggered.
segment.target: Any changes related to Active Directory forest trusts (especially creation of the new trust) must be monitored and alerts should be triggered.

segment.source: If this change was not planned, investigate the reason for the change.
segment.target: If this change was not planned, investigate the reason for the change.
